R Markdown renders to four presentation formats:

* [beamer_presentation](http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/beamer_presentation_format.html) - PDF presentations with beamer
* [ioslides_presentation](http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/ioslides_presentation_format.html) - HTML presentations with ioslides
* [slidy_presentation](http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/slidy_presentation_format.html) - HTML presentations with slidy
* [revealjs::revealjs_presentation](http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/revealjs_presentation_format.html) - HTML presentations with reveal.js

Each format will intuitively divide your content into slides, with a new slide beginning at each first or second level header.

Insert a horizontal rule (`***`) into your document to create a manual slide break. Create incremental bullets with `>-`, as in the [.Rmd file below](demos/10-presentation.Rmd).
